flawed_nl_solution:
One day, 2000-500=<<2000-500=5100>>5100 cans of food were left.
It was then restocked to 5100+1500=<<5100+1500=6600>>6600 cans.
1000*2=<<1000*2=2000>>2000 cans were taken the next day.
6600-2000=<<6600-2000=4600>>4600 cans were left.
It was restocked once more to 4600+3000=<<4600+3000=7600>>7600 cans of food.
Carla gave away 500+2000=<<500+2000=2500>>2500 cans of food.
#### 2500

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1500, not 5100. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
